dialogues.text: No longer will man and beast bend under the backbreaking load of stone and rock and timber... because Fibrerock is so light that even a child can handle it. (pause) That's why on Monday we're going to hire two dozen children from Bedrock Technical Junior High. They'll be replacing the 36 heavy equipment operators, 15 shaft diggers and 22 laborers we're laying off today. Your pink slips will be in your final pay envelopes along with a ticket to the grand opening of Slate City. It's non-transferable, so hang on to it. Thank you, and have a nice weekend.

dialogues.speaker: THE QUARRY YARD 115
dialogues.text: The workers stand slack-jawed and stunned.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Laid off --?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Pink slip --?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Thanks to Fred Flintstone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Flintstone! What kinda shop steward are you? All eyes swivel and bore into Fred, who is as shocked as anyone.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fred. You gotta do something about this!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I do? (realizing) I mean, I do, yeah! He squares his shoulders, marches off.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (proudly) That's my Fred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slate is practicing hitting golf balls into an automatic putting cup. Lava and some office workers are checking a blueprint against a model of "Slate City" which is made out of Fibrerock. A ball shoots back at Slate, who tees up again.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PUTTING CUP 117
dialogues.text: A little MOUSE in a complete hockey outfit jumps to catch the ball. Stopping it with his little hockey stick, the Mouse gasps, raises its hockey mask.

dialogues.speaker: MOUSE
dialogues.text: Whew. And it's still pre-season. He whaps the ball to Slate again.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 118
dialogues.text: Slate tees up the ball again. Fred barges in, banging the door. Startled, Slate drives the ball instead of putting it. It sails across the room and SHATTERS a PICTURE of Mrs. Slate.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (furious) Flintstone! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (undeterred) Mr. Slate -- we gotta talk --

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: We do, eh? About what?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: About those guys outside, Mr. Slate. Some of â€˜em, well, they been here for years. And you, well, you can't lay them off just like -- (snapping fingers) -- that! Slate looks at Lava, who shrugs. Slate looks back at Fred, stays surprisingly calm. He toys with the putter, balances it on his palm.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Of course I can, Fred. I can lay them off like -- (snapping fingers) -- that, or like -- (a different style snap) -- that, or like -- He does a really nifty snap which combines with a buck- and-wing with the putter.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: -- that.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (bravura slipping) Oh, you can, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Of course he can, Flintstone. It's his quarry.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (still calm, warm) That's right. Why -- (chuckling) I could lock the front door and go fishing if I wanted! Lava laughs along with the office staff and Slate. Fred chuckles a little to fit in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (winking) Why, I could even fire Lava here if I wanted. Lava quivers with mock surprise. Everyone really laughs, now.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Or... (wiping away a tear) I could fire you, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (guffawing) Me! Ah, ha, that's rich, Mr. Slate, that's -- Suddenly Fred stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Flintstone, Lava, here, recommended that you be in charge of public relations to get Fibrerock off to a good start. I'm a member of that public, Flintstone, and I have to Say... this isn't a good start. I'm getting a bad feeling about Fibrerock. A bad feeling about... you. You want that feeling to go away, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Uh... well, gee, I... uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Good. Then turn around and walk out of here and we'll forget all about this. Fred swallows, looks at Lava, goes meekly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Workers watch expectantly as Fred comes out. They AD LIB --

dialogues.speaker: WORKERS
dialogues.text: Well? What'd he say...? Ol1' Freddie boy told him a thing or two... Probably got us a raise... Right, Fred...? Fred...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Akkk... something... noble... man ... job... nose... wheel... shoulder... grindstone... hommm... yggggg...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (worried) Fred? Fred staggers over to his locker, opens it... gets in, and closes the door. We hear a MUFFLED SOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the workers slowly realize the mighty Casey has struck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Wilma stand, determined, while the kids gripe.

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: But, Mommy, I wanna go roller skating...

dialogues.speaker: BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Yeagh... 'hend thugh guys wher ghoing -- (swallow, munch) -- to play rockball at Paleolithic Park -- Betty wipes Bam-Bam's mouth, smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Well, you're both going to change your plans. Your new school is going to have a talent show... and you're going to have some talent.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: You don't have to win... honorable mention or most Kongenial Kids is perfectly acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: (aside) As long as we beat the pants offa Mrs. Slate's nephew... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Young lady, this is not about beating pants, this is about becoming a well rounded child. Now, what kind of act will you do?

dialogues.speaker: BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: How about a disappearing act? He takes a tentative step away but Betty grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: We're waiting. Pebbles and Bam-Bam sigh, huddle. We hear snatches of discussion...

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: ... Wanna recite something? Nah, what are we, little "Inky Dinky Spidersaurus...'? kids? How 'bout magic tricks? We could cut up a newspaper --

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: But then we'd need a hammer BAM- BAM and chisel... oh, what about That dumb thing? You that thing with Dino? think so...? Pebbles turns, the decision made.

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: Okay. We're gonna sing a song with Dino. Instantly, on cue, Dino leaps out of nowhere, holding a straw hat and a cane. Wilma and Betty look at each other, skeptical. Bam-Bam reaches into his shirt and takes out a whistle. He blows it --

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: A one-and-a-two and-a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC comes UP and Dino and his little friends do a dance routine we will call "The Dino Dance." It is a spectac- ular blend of soft-shoe and the kind of dog-and-pony-show gags usually seen in the circus or on the Ed Sullivrock show. Most importantly, the routine includes the following: A) Dino leaps back and forth through a hoop. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: B) The kids tie down a jump rope and Dino does a wire walk. C) And finally, Dino uses his tail to flip the kids onto his back, culminating in a big "ta-da" after they all slide down the rope for a big finish.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS
dialogues.text: (winding up) You can keep the Twist, The Frug and Hop I don't need to Shimmy, I don't need to Bop â€˜Cause I'm doin' doin' doin' The Igneous Rock! Panting for breath, Pebbles, Bam-Bam and Dino wait for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: (to Wilma, impressed) Well? Think they're ready for the talent show?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: I think they're ready for Rock Vegas. As they laugh and hug the kids and Dino, we --

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fellow Water Buffalo. Ina few moments we will cast our votes for the lodge officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Fred as he leans back in his usual chair.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: The election committee will make the preparations.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (confident ) Since when do you have to prepare for a landslide, right, guys? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause as Fred waits for a reply. He turns... SHOT WIDENS as he realizes no one is sitting near him. He looks around and sees --

dialogues.speaker: FRED'S POSTER 126
dialogues.text: It's been altered to read "Fred Finkstone." Also added to Fred's image are horns, a beard and other choice touches.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 127
dialogues.text: Fred looks around, sees Barney approaching, having just left a group of angry Buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barn -- w-what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: They're mad at you, Fred... it's understandable, I mean, they all got laid off today -- Fred crosses to the other guys, puts on a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Guys, guys, come on now -- what's a quarry fulla layoffs got to do with a lodge fulla Buffaloes?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Is that a riddle? Give me a second --

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: (stepping forward) I'll tell ya what! Mosta the guys in this lodge work for Mr. Slate --

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: -- You mean used to work for him -- until somebody opened their big mouth --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Fellas, come on. We're all big boys here -- He gestures vaguely towards the outside world, then back to the little band of brothers here.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Surely we can separate in our minds work, and play... Job, and Lodge... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: (pointing at Fred) Candidate and double-crossing back stabber? (turning) Herdmaster! I move we commence the meeting... and the election!

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: I second the motion!

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: All in favor, say --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wait, wait... Your Antlerness, please, one second -- ! Fred grabs Barney by the shoulder, spins him around, pushes him forward like a refrigerator on a dolly, stands him up center stage.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barney, you gotta tell the other guys what really happened. Tell "em the story behind Fibrerock. The true story. The room quiets. Barney clears his throat. Fred waits, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Well, there's not much to tell. (trying to remember Fred's phraseology) True, I got a cut... but Fred's got a gut.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: No, no, the rest --!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I remember! I got the mind, but Fred's got the behind. Right, Fred? Barney turns, gives Fred a big wink. Fred groans.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Brother Rubble. The Buffaloes will now have their secret vote. (a command) Fit... furs! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone pulls their horned fezzes down over their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: Paw... ground! Everyone does a bull-like stomp and scrape.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: All for Piltdown, bellow now! The room ECHOES with MOOSE-LIKE SNORTS.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: All for Flintstone, bellow now! Fred snorts, sounding like Herb Alpert's lonely bull. Even under his furry fez we see him "looking around" desperately, hoping to hear one more snort. He kind of sneaks in one more forlorn grunt which fades away... finally, as Fred squirms miserably, there is one more lonely snort... from Barney, of course.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: Order furs! The fezzes come up.

dialogues.speaker: HERDMASTER
dialogues.text: The snorts have it! Brother Piltdown, it is my privilege to install you as the new Exalted Herdmaster Erect Antler and Big Buck of our Lodge. If you'll come forward, I will present you with the tokens of office. Cheers and applause as Piltdown goes to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING FRED AND BARNEY 128
dialogues.text: Fred's a broken man. Barney moves over, puts his arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I voted for you, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Big deal, after you screwed everything up in the first place...! Barney reacts, really hurt. He moves away on the bench. Fred's so agitated he doesn't even realize it.  129 130 131 132 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piltdown accepts the festooned fez and shoulder ribbon, smiles at the group.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Brother Chairman. Fellow Buffaloes, I'm a man of few words. It's no secret that most of our lodge members are also members of Amalgamated Neolithic 101... which means that most of us aren't gonna be able to make our cave payments next month. So my agenda for tonight... ends right now. There's a time to be a Buffalo... there's a time ta be a brown nosin' double-crossin' creep... All heads turn and swivel to look at Fred... swivel back.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: and there's a time to stand up and be a man! So let's go down there and make the Slate shop into slate scrap... then we'll see how he gets along without the heavy equipment operators of Neolithic 101! Meeting adjourned! With angry grumbles and threats, the meeting breaks up. Fezzes are thrown into cubby holes and hard hats are slapped on. The Buffalo run out. When the dust clears, we see that only one member has avoided the herding instinct: Barney. Now, he turns, runs into --

dialogues.speaker: BUFFALO LODGE
dialogues.text: Fred is at the bar, opening a beer. He looks wistfully at the old, framed picture on the wall -- reacts as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: PICTURE 131
dialogues.text: Even his childhood shot has been defaced.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 132
dialogues.text: He sets his jaw with a "screw 'em" expression, downs his beer. Then Barney runs up, shakes him by the shoulders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fred! Fred! The Buffalo are heading for big trouble -- !

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: No kidding. They rejected the best candidate --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No, no, not that! Piltdown's got the guys all worked up and they're heading down to the quarry! They're gonna wreck the assembly line!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (genuinely worried) Oh, no! That -- that's horrible! (pause) We could end up with half a percent of nothing!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No, Fred, if they do that they'll be breakin' the law! Our brother Buffalo could go to jail!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, that, too... come on, Barn, we gotta stop â€˜em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent, empty. CAMERA PANS FROM the still yard TO the gate. Down the road, we see Piltdown leading the angry mob. Quickly, they go to the gate, climb up and over it!

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Okay! Let's start with Slate's golf trophies and work our way up to the assembly line! AD LIB angry cheers, and the mob storms into the plant, knocking aside equipment and supplies.

dialogues.speaker: IN CAR
dialogues.text: Both pedaling like mad. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I don't believe this... how did things ever get this out of hand -- ?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I know. Makes you wish things were back the way they were... before we was big executives.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't go that far... Suddenly they're interrupted by the sound of a SIREN. Fred looks back and sees --

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR AND GRAVEL 135
dialogues.text: Coming up from rear. Feldspar grabs his megaphone as he pulls abreast of Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: Flintstone! Pull over!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Oh, no, not now... Feldspar signals Fred onto the shoulder. Fred smiles, nods...

dialogues.speaker: FRED'S FEET 136
dialogues.text: He slams them down through the floorboard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's CAR SKIDS, spins out, whirling around like a record on a turntable. It jerks to a halt 180 degrees later, and then ROARS off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR 138
dialogues.text: So astonished he follows this action with his head... a bad move because --

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: Sarge! Look out -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol CAR runs off the road, CRASHING into a stone fire hydrant. Water squirts into the air. Feldspar and Gravel are drenched. They're just coming to their senses when the ground heaves -- the car's front wheels rise --  140 141 142 143 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS we see that the water spout is actually coming from the blowhole of a whale which now sticks a bit of its head up from under the broken curb.

dialogues.speaker: WHALE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna sue you for everything you got --

dialogues.speaker: SLATE QUARRY
dialogues.text: Led by Piltdown, the workers have grabbed a big timber which they're using like a battering ram on the doors of the assembly line building. Suddenly, with a crash, the doors go down! Piltdown and Pyrite stand back while the angry workers rush past them.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: (loudly) Now we'll show 'em who's boss!

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: They can't push us around! Piltdown and Pyrite smash a few items to get everybody juiced up, and then... when no one is looking... they slip out the back!

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF QUARRY
dialogues.text: Fred pulls into the lot, slams his feet down to stop -- we hear SKIDDING -- they fishtail all over, slam right through a storage area for crates and barrels which collapse all around them. Finally they slam broadside into the main Quarry build- ing, knocking a hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney cough in the rising dust. Neither one of them sees what we see, which is that visible in the hole in the wall is the Slate Company's granite-doored safe... and right beside it is the Xenosaurus, which now jumps up, startled, dropping a crowbar and a big hand drill. Recovering its composure, the Xenosaurus grabs up the tools as well as a big canvas bag and tiptoes away, vanishing just as our heroes stir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (double-taking) Barn! Did you see that -- ? (peering through the dust) -- Huh, now it's gone... I coulda sworn...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Come on Fred. Time to earn those big bucks. They rush into the plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the workers continue their rampage, Piltdown and Pyrite reappear.

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: Darn that Flintstone and Rubble... they're gonna screw everything up...

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Not if we give 'em a nice long vacation... in the hospital. Saying this, he grips tightly on a wrench. Then some rampaging workers rush by. Piltdown gives them an encour- aging cheer, and then he and Pyrite lead them up some stairs to the assembly line catwalk. There, Pyrite begins SMASHING some LIGHT FIXTURES with a club, while Piltdown uses brute strength to snap big support beams which he flings below.

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE 145
dialogues.text: Winds up for another baseball-type swing -- but as he follows through, the ball-shaped light fixture jerks up on its cable. Unable to stop in time, Pyrite spins around, falls on his ass. Barney drops down INTO VIEW, hanging horizontally from the rafters. He's holding the light fixture with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Stee-rike one! Heh-hey. Ready for a curve ball? Pyrite doesn't have a sense of humor; club in hand, he jumps up, starts chasing Barney through the rafters.  146 147 148 149 69.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN 146
dialogues.text: Spits on his hand, grabs another big beam. He pulls down on it... but it doesn't snap, it goes right up again. Puzzled, he pulls down on it again... there's another see-saw motion... . This time Piltdown goes with the flow, pushes up and peers under the beam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is hanging on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Brother Piltdown... can we talk about this, antler to antler? Piltdown roars, begins slamming the girder up and down.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Guess not... Fred inches down the shuddering beam, jumps off. Freed of Fred's weight, the other end "BOINGS" down on Piltdown's head. He groans, recovers in time to chase after Fred.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND PYRITE 148
dialogues.text: Square off in the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Give me your best shot. Pyrite swings. Barney ducks and Pyrite SMASHES a WINDOW pane. Barney dodges again and the same thing happens. Getting cocky, Barney does it one more time... but this time the window is hinged in the center and the swivel action after the hit whaps Barney on the back and knocks him into Pyrite's next blow.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 149
dialogues.text: Is backpedaling away from Piltdown on the upper super- structure of the assembly line. Fred scrapes one foot in an arc in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Dare you to cross that line. Piltdown crosses it.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: That line. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Piltdown crosses it. Fred "marks" another one. Piltdown doesn't even wait for the challenge, takes a giant step. Oops. Bad idea: The last "line" was at the edge of a straight drop! Piltdown yelps, "treads air" in the best cartoon manner -- and then desperately grabs a handful of Fred's clothing! Both men fall -- at the last minute Piltdown catches a ladder!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Fred lands with a thud right in the clay mold used to form the Fibre products! Worse, the impact arouses the goatasauruses out of their sleep. Dutifully, they rise, and then ram both sides of the mold just as Fred is struggling to his feet! Fred's yell is muffled by the clay.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ASSEMBLY LINE ANIMALS 151
dialogues.text: Aroused by the "start up" of the assembly line, they do their job. Fibre foam begins to chug down the trough: The alligator crane picks up the mold, shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 152
dialogues.text: is flung to the conveyor belt, stiffly caked in clay.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIBRE MOLD 153
dialogues.text: shudders -- and shakes out a Fibre statue of... Fred!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 154
dialogues.text: The real Fred, moving stiffly like a robot, is getting to his feet when his Fibre doppleganger slams him to the mat again! A moment later, another "Fred" drops down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN 155
dialogues.text: Has descended the ladder, hopping mad. Now, he sees Fred coming toward him... Piltdown breaks a big lever off the equipment, swings -- reacts astonished as "FRED" SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 156
dialogues.text: Back down the line, he's seen this. His clay-caked Adam's apple gulps. Quickly, he turns and tries to "tip-toe" away -- then, with a CREAK and CRUNCH -- the clay and Fibre all over him solidifies! Desperate, he tries to move... can't!  157 158 159 160 161 71.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN 157
dialogues.text: Watches, confused, as dozens of Fred Flintstones chug towards him on the belt. He shrugs, smashes the next one in line. Another phoney. He smashes the next one...

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: Dodging Pyrite's renewed attack. Now, Barney becomes aware of the activated assembly line. Getting an idea, he moves behind an inspection table, grabs a big rubber stamp. Pyrite comes around the corner... Barney's head butts him in the gut, dodges under his legs! Then, as Pyrite stumbles, Barney stamps his ass with the word "REJECT." Pyrite looks back, sees this, reddens... raises his club.

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: Reject, huh? Whaddya say we reject your head? He raises the club... when an alligator swings down and grabs him by the seat of his pants! Pyrite drops the club, howls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alligator crane swings him away and over a big bin marked REJECTS -- and drops him. Howling, Pyrite falls into a big bin of broken and defective Fibrerock goods.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY 160
dialogues.text: Chuckles to himself... and then looks down, reacts. CAMERA ADJUSTS and we see that Piltdown has smashed yet another of the duplicate Freds. Worried, Barney looks around, sees that he's just above the Fibrefoam chute. Without another thought, he jumps into it -- slides downward like a passenger on the Magerock Mountain Log Flume ride --

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 161
dialogues.text: Piltdown is about to swing at the real Fred -- when Barney sails out of the end of the chute and slams into him and Fred! All three of them roll across the floor towards --  162 163 72.

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE BUILDING 162
dialogues.text: where a squad of policemen has just appeared -- led by a dripping wet Feldspar and Gravel!

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: All right! You're all under arr -- Wham! Barney, Fred and Piltdown roll right into the cops, who go flying like (what else?) tenpins, complete with appropriate sound.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Whattya know. Even got the spare again... Then he gasps as he looks over at Fred, whose head has just fallen off! Pause. Fred's real head slowly pokes up out of the clay and Fibre shoulders. Before he can extricate himself further, Feldspar and his men are dragging them out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden bars delineate the holding cells. "Wanted" posters of stone are hanging on the walls. As we watch, the contrite buffalos are bailed out by friends and relations. Wilma and Betty are just now clunking down stone money on the night sergeant's desk.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Barney, I don't understand... what came over you boys?

dialogues.speaker: EXITING BUFFALO
dialogues.text: "Night, Barney. (to Fred) So long, fatso.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFALO
dialogues.text: See ya, Barn. (pause) Flintstone, you're dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFALO
dialogues.text: â€˜Night, pal. â€˜Night, slimeball.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Fred, is there something you want to tell me about the lodge meeting? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I don't wanna talk about it. Besides, who cares about a bunch of jerks running around with furs on their heads? I'm more of a country club guy myself anyway... He goes out, hardly looking at Barney. Wilma and Betty look at each other, mystified... then Wilma follows Fred out, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lava stands in the shadows beside his Porscherock. Piltdown and Pyrite are with him. In the b.g., Fred and Wilma drive away.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: A simple little heist -- I gave you everything but the keys and you blew it --

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Hey, we got the union guys to break in and create a distraction, didn't we? Who knew Flintstone and Rubble would show up, too?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: The day after Slate City opens there's going to be an audit. If the stuff isn't gone by then we'll all be doing time until the Bronze Age.

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mister Lava... we're on top of it. They both turn and start down an alley... jamming together as they do. Lava sighs... then jumps as Barney comes up behind him and taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mister Lava -- ? I think you oughta know... something could be wrong with the Fibrerock mix.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (thrown) How do you know that? (recovering) I mean... ah, why do you say that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It tastes different.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Tastes... different?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yup. See, ever since I started with Fibrerock -- I mean, since me and Fred started with it, I always take a little taste of the Fibre foam. And tonight's batch, well... I didn't get much of it, but it seems a little off. (smacking his lips) Can't fool the old taste buds, heh-heh. I think there might be an ingredient missing. So tomorrow, I'll run a couple of tests and stuff --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Rubble, Rubble! We're fighting a deadline to finish Slate City... and we're not pulling the plug on production to satisfy your tastebuds! If you ask me, you and your tastebuds are overworked overwrought... how long have you been with us, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Nine days, Mister Lava.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Jumping Jurrasic, no wonder you're so run down. He puts his arm around Barney, leads him towards the car where Betty is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: I'm authorizing a nice vacation for you, Rubble. Starting tomorrow. You can catch some rays, maybe invent something... hey, how about Fibrerock, the sequel, part II -- ?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: No, don't try and thank me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slate and Lava are examining a newer and larger model of Slate City. It's even more grandiose than its predecessor. Now the housing development has two huge office buildings beside it, and then a convention center beyond that.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: ... AS you can see, the Fibrerock is so light we're using it for construction, for furnishings... for everything. You can't stack a two-bedroom cave this high... but the sky's the limit with Fibrerock!

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: "Sky's the limit'... 'sky's the limit'... why, these two buildings, they... they practically scrape the sky! We should call them... Slate scrapers!

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: That's brilliant, Unc... Mister Slate. In fact, maybe you can help me with the centerpiece of the complex... (indicating the convention center) ... I wanna call 'em the FibreSphere and the ! ' something Needle... but I just can't...

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (modestly) How about, 'Slate Needle'?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: "Slate Need...' (astonished) How do you keep coming up with these? It's uncanny.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (shrugging) It's a gift...

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (casually) Oh, that reminds me, sign these, will you... just a few overruns . minor cost problems... that's it... thank you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Slate's so busy admiring his moment to himself he hardly listens to what Lava's saying, just runs his stylus through the wet clay of the statements, meanwhile "framing" the model city in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (heading for the door) ... Oh, Mister Slate, we're going to hold the Bedrock Junior Talent Show in the uh, 'Slate Needle.' Good for public relations -- Lava breaks off. He's just looked out the window and seen --

dialogues.speaker: QUARRY BELOW WINDOW 166
dialogues.text: A small figure appears behind some of the equipment, tiptoeing from console to cabinet and thus towards the assembly line. Wearing sunglasses with attached nose and a hook-on beard, it at first appears to be some sort of bizarre hermit or bum... and then we realize, hey, this is Barney!

dialogues.speaker: LAVA 167
dialogues.text: Looks around, spots Piltdown and Pyrite, now resplendent in security guard uniforms. Lava whistles softly to get their attention, can't. Then he sees one of Slate's golf trophies. He shrugs, throws it.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Reacts as the trophy bounces off his head, then looks up to see Lava gesticulating. Piltdown nods, grabs Pyrite in tow.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY 169
dialogues.text: Looking around carefully, Barney takes out a Thermos bottle, unscrews the top, and quickly dunks it into the Fibrerock foam. Then he tiptoes 0.S., right into the massive bulk of --

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN 170
dialogues.text: -- who looks down at him with a big smile, Pyrite at his side.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Can we help you... sir? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (fake crotchety voice) Ah, yup, yup, young feller... jest show me the way to the personnel office... I'm lookin' fer a job as a custodian...

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: Our pleasure. Then they grab Barney with such force that the THERMOS drops and SHATTERS, drag him 0.S. --

dialogues.speaker: SLATE QUARRY
dialogues.text: Barney is tossed outside, landing in a heap amidst the picketing workers of Neolithic 101.

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Ya can start by cleaning the street with your pants! Still laughing, Piltdown and Pyrite cross over to Lava, who has come out of the office building.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: That takes care of the half-pint. (pause) Now to deal with the half-wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lava walks Fred from the door into the color-coordinated high-style room.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (on the move) But Barney doesn't want to take a vacation -- he says he's gotta be here to check up on the Fibrefoam --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (pointedly) -- Oh? Or check up on us? Emotionally, Lava turns, indicates a picture of Slate on the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Flintstone, that... that's a slap in the face of our founder... our employer... our uncle. (turning back, another tone) Unless, of course, you agree with Rubble... that Mister Slate isn't capable of running this operation that I'm not capable of running it?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (nervous) Of course not, Mister Lava. But --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Call me Jerry. Sit down, please... Fred complies. Lava winces as his designer FURNITURE CREAKS under Fred's weight, but he only says --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (offering one) . Cigar?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Why, yeah, sure, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Fred, let me get to the bottom slime. Some men -- you and me, for instance -- we're cut out for the big time, the big bucks... (eyeing Fred's girth) the big everything. Lava smiles, prepares the tips on two cigars. He puts each one in turn in a gizmo on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually a frame supporting a little LIZARD. The Lizard bites the tip off the cigar, practically chokes on it, finally manages to spit it out with difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: LIZARD
dialogues.text: (aside) When they say smoking is bad for your health, they're not kidding...  174 175 176 79.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: And others? Wellll... Now Lava takes out a lighter, leans across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lava works the mechanism, two wooden twigs rub rapidly across each other and ignite.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: ... Now, I know your pal Barney had a small part in the preliminary research and development of Fibrerock...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, actually, I wouldn't say small part... I'd say...

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Kind of a medium-sized... well, almost medium-sized... well, really a semi-partial assistant counsulting type, of --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (giving Fred a playful punch) You're too kind, Flintstone, that's what I like about you. But you're a big guy with a big decision to make. Are you gonna keep covering for Barney, keep pulling his acornsauruses out of the fire... or are you going to concentrate on your own important duties?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, gee, that's tough one -- (pause) -- Uh, what are my important duties?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Publicity, Flintstone, publicity! (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAVA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that's why I've got a little surprise for you... for the man who made Fibrerock a household word, I want you to meet the man who's going to make you a household word... Lava throws the door open. Fred's jaw drops as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: R-rockin' Leach? Indeed, it is he, and he smiles, extends his hands.

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: "Ello, Fred. I've â€˜eard a lot h'about you from Mister Lava. H'at's why we're going to put you on our program.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: M-me? On -- on television?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (patting his back, sotto) Right, Fred. As long as you forget all this nonsense about Barney.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (still in a dazed thrill) Barney who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three big dino-mounted trucks are parked in front. You have to read the words on all three: "ROCKSTYLES OF..."

dialogues.speaker: "THE RICH..." "AND FAMOUS."
dialogues.text: Technicians roll out gear, set up big spotlights, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockin' Leach is surveying the place with an aide. Fred and Wilma are with them. Leach makes a "frame" with his hands, "pans" the area. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: Hmm. Lovely little guest 'ouse, Mister Flintstone. So simple, so ordinary, so unexceptional... why, h'it's almost quaint. Let's say we start with the camera â€˜ere, except... Leach breaks off, looks over the fence at the Rubble homestead. He shakes his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: W-what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: Well, just look at that yard over there... barbecues and trikes, not exactly the right image...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (pointing) Maybe you could move those plants to block them out...?

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: Good idea. Rodney, get 'hoppin' with those greens. The aide nods, gathers some workers. They start moving the potted plants. Puzzled, Wilma comes over.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Fred, this was supposed to be a "typical evening' at the Flintstones, and you invited fifty people I don't even know. Now what's going on? Where are they taking my ficus-sauruses?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: It's the Rubble yard, Wilma. It's just not the right image... He starts away, suddenly notices his own barbecue and trikes... quickly, without missing a stride, he tosses a tarp over them, slides a potted plant over for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND BETTY'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Betty, hair and face done, but still in a slip, is putting a reluctant Bam-Bam into a cute little blazer. In the f.g., Barney finishes tying a black tie, then struggles into a dinner jacket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: I don't know why you want to go to this thing... after the way Fred's been treating you lately --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fred's in a high-powered executive job, Betty. There's a lot of pressure on him.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Yeah... and it's all around his belt. If it wasn't for poor Wilma I wouldn't give him the Geological Time --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Trust me, Betty. After the Fibrerock debut, he'll be the same old Fred. Both react to the sound of HAMMERING and SAWING. Curious, they go out the sliding bedroom door into the yard and see --

dialogues.speaker: THE FENCE 180
dialogues.text: The television crew has just finished nailing boards up over the top of the fence. Now the big potted plants are dropped into place. With each hammer stroke or thud a little more of the late afternoon sun is shut off until Barney and Betty are in shadow. Finally a canvas tarp is tossed as gracefully as pizza dough, sails into the Rubble yard and covers their bird bath. One last stray end lands on Barney's head.

dialogues.speaker: FLINTSTONE YARD
dialogues.text: Inside each one, a little BIRD in hardhat and smoked visor lights up the arc, gets knocked on his butt when it catches.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: (slowly getting up) I've heard of a flash in the pan, but this is ridiculous...

dialogues.speaker: ON DINO 182
dialogues.text: He's squirming uncomfortably under the attentions of two crew members who are busy with scissors and combs and brushes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finally, they're done and leave him. He has been cut and trimmed like a French poodle. He gets a glimpse of himself in the swimming pool and freaks out. Then he arches his back, shakes out the hairstyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAIN TITLE of the show can be heard 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And now... the man who brings you the romance and excitement you crave... from the casinos of Monte Carlrock to the glamour of Hollyrock, here's your guide to the Rockstyles of the Rich and Famous, Rockin' Leach! Leach takes his cue from the director --

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: (INTO CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. Tonight we come to you live from the ah... charming pied a terre of the man of the â€˜our, Fred Flintstone -- Leach pauses, hearing the sound of someone CHIPPING AWAY at a stone tablet... he looks up at --

dialogues.speaker: FRED 184
dialogues.text: He has just carved "FREDERICK" into a stone cue card and points to it.

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: â€˜Ere we are at the 'ome of Bedrock's man o' the â€˜our Frederick Flint-- More CHIPPING. Leach looks up and sees:

dialogues.speaker: FRED 186
dialogues.text: Now he's carved something grander. Leach sighs, goes on.

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: â€˜Ere we are at the fabulous 'ome of Bedrock's man o' the â€˜our Frederick von Flintstone --  187 188 189 84.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE HOUSE 187
dialogues.text: Barney and Betty appear, Bam-Bam in tow. They come out into the yard. Betty waves at Wilma, who comes over whispers.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Thank heaven. There isn't one person I know here.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You mean beside Fred?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: I mean including Fred. They look over at --

dialogues.speaker: THE SET 188
dialogues.text: Where Leach has pulled Fred on camera. Fred is posing, fluffing his ascot, etc. We notice a "FVF" embroidered patch on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: Frederick, of course, is the man behind Fibrerock -- the invention that some predict will revolutionize life in the future. Frederick, 'ow does it feel to know that you â€˜ave personally brought the Stone Age as we know it to a long-deserved end?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (very affected accent) Well, Rockin', you're right, I have affected destiny for all mankind, and it's a sobering thought. However, if I may add a personal note at this time, I myself cannot personally take all the credit for Fibrerock...

dialogues.speaker: WILMA, BARNEY, BETTY 189
dialogues.text: react with hopeful expressions --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sotto, to them) See? What'd I tell ya?  190 191 192 193 194 85.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: No, I could never have done it without the inspiration and support of a very special person. I'm speaking, of course, of my close friend and associate, Mister Slate, founder and C.E.0O. of Slate Construction...

dialogues.speaker: WILMA, BARNEY, BETTY 191
dialogues.text: Barney's face falls. So do Wilma and Betty's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slate City! In the far future, Manhattan will have New Jersey... Philadelphia will have Levittown... L.A. will have Burbank... but today Bedrock has... Slate City!

dialogues.speaker: "SLATE NEEDLE" AND FIBRESPHERE 193
dialogues.text: Both decorated in pennants and bunting, connected to each other by a gangway six stories up. Block letters on the Fibresphere proclaim "Slate Construction brings you THE WONDERFUL WORLD OF FIBRE." A heroic statue of Slate himself stands close by the structures. (Sphere and needle, of course, are dead on parodies of the Trylon and Perisphere, centerpieces of the '39 World's Fair.) A limousine pedaled by two chauffeurs pulls up. Mr. and Mrs. Slate and Lava, and Lava's son, POINDEXTER, get out. It is immediately evident that the little obnoxious acorn hasn't fallen far from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER
dialogues.text: Wow! Is this ever keen! Dad, you promise I can cut in all the lines?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Of course, Poindexter, of course. They head for the mastodon and pully-powered elevator. Standing there are Piltdown and Pyrite, both in security guard uniforms. (Piltdown is carrying a vaguely-familiar satchel). Lava gives them a big look. They nod. As the elevator rises, his two cronies duck into a stairwell marked "NO ADMITTANCE."

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see Pebbles and Bam-Bam squirming uncomfortably in their party clothes. They take some canapes off of a table, take a bite... spit them out.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 195
dialogues.text: Stands beaming, nodding to his guests.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hello, hello. Bon soir. Good to see ya... glad you could make it...

dialogues.speaker: GUEST
dialogues.text: (unconvincingly) Hello, Frank...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Fred -- there's the bar, make yourself at home -- mi casa es votre casa, so, when in Rome and all that --

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: (coming over) Fred, can I talk to you -- ? Fred? Fred? (concerned) We have a serious problem with Betty and Barney.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (alarmed) You mean you can see their house -- ?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: (exasperated) I mean you're treating them horribly! What's come over you, Fred? Does a little money mean so much to you that you just turn your back on the things that really count?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wilma, I'm shocked. I wouldn't do that. Okay, I admit it: I'm trying to make an impression here, I wanna look good, I wanna be a success... He takes her hand, looks into her eyes. For a moment, Wilma's face softens. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: ... But deep down inside, I'm still the same lovable guy you Married -- (pause) -- Frederick von Flintstone the third --

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Arrrgh -- ! She throws up her hands, stalks away.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCTION ASSISTANT 196
dialogues.text: Hangs up the sea shell phone, runs over to Leach. P.A. That was our location guy at Slate City. They just moved the ribbon cutting up by an hour. Guests are already starting to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: LEACH
dialogues.text: Fabulous! I've â€˜ad enough crab meat and crabgrass to last me a year. All right, boys, that's a wrap!

dialogues.speaker: FRED 197
dialogues.text: In the middle of a tight little group which is pigging out. Fred seems oblivious to the fact that they're oblivious to him.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: . Yas, yas, it's a challenging commodity market these days. Personally, I'm considering petrified forests, but they do say that volcano futures are ready to explode, ha, ha... Suddenly Fred notices that his "audience" has evaporated. He looks around, sees everyone headed for their cars, the TV crew packing up, etc.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hey, whoa, what's happening -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEACH'S AIDE
dialogues.text: What's happening isn't happening here. The action's over at Slate City. Oh, thanks for the booze, Ed --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Fred! He stumbles through the thinning crowd, clutching at elbows.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hey, what's the hurry? We got a cake shaped like a piece of Fibrerock... I got it, how about some charades? No, even better twenty questions: â€˜Am I animal, mineral, or fossil'...? Oh, I heard a great one the other day a guy walks in a bar with a duckasaurus on his head and the bartender says -- this'll kill you, the bartender says -- Fred stops, running out of steam along with his moment of glory. He stands alone on the lawn. Wilma slowly comes up to him,

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Fred... I... I'm sorry it's not working out... Fred turns, puts on a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean, not working out? They're goin' party hopping, that's all. That's what ya do in society, Wilma... you cruise around. They'll go over to Slate's shindig for a while, then they'll come back here.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Fred...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: You go on over to Slate City, okay?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Fred, I want to be here with you -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Nah, me and some of the guys from the country club, we're gonna play poker, yeah, big stakes poker until everybody comes back. Go on with the others. The kids got their show to put on anyway... and I wouldn't want people to think... to think the Flintstones were party poopers. She doesn't know what to say, or what she can say that won't shatter his shaky image. She sighs, kisses him, then calls out.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Come on, Pebbles. We're going to another party.

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES
dialogues.text: Will there be real food there?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: We'll find out together. She takes the girl's hand and goes to the door, where the last of Leach's crew is just going out. Suddenly Betty catches up to her, Bam-Bam in tow.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Wilma, wait. I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: If friends can't do something stupid, who can? Wilma smiles, touched.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Besides... (lowering her voice) Maybe if we leave the boys alone...? Wilma nods, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The film crew caravan is already leaving as Wilma, Betty and the kids get into the Rubble car. The last TV crew- man extinguishes the big spotlight. The house is dark forlorn in the fading twilight.  199 200 201 202 203 204 90.

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF YARD
dialogues.text: Fred sits forlorn in the rubble of his party. Dino comes over, nuzzles his leg.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Just you and me now, Dino. Yeah. That's okay. Man and man's best friend. He gives Dino one of the canapes. Dino tastes it, makes a face, spits it out. DINO runs off, going "PTOOIE" all the way. We see him run to the corner, jump in Betty's car and drive away.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 200
dialogues.text: sighs, looks around, down at his blazer and the "FVF" patch. He suddenly rips it off in a fury. Then he looks at --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 202
dialogues.text: Fred stares at it, his face slowly darkening. Then he grabs a lawn chair from the yard, begins to smash it in a fury against the divider. The wall cracks, splinters; the potted plants go flying.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 203
dialogues.text: His anger spent, he stands panting, splattered with dirt... then he sees --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DIRT-COVERED FIGURE 204
dialogues.text: -- standing in the ruins of the wall. The figure sneezes, whacks dirt off of itself. It's --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) B... Barney?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (moving closer) Hiya, Fred. (noticing his ruined tuxedo) Boy, the rental place is gonna be mad... (eyeing the mess) . You feeling better, pal? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: "Pal'? How can you call me that? Barney, I... I've been such a... such a... such a...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Creep?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. But more of a --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (helpful tone) Fool?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Slimeball? Louse? Jackass? (snapping fingers) Stuck-up blimpasaurus?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (wincing, but taking it) Barney... can... Can you ever forgive me for being such a jerk?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (stepping closer) Sure, Fred. (smiling) I've had lots of practice.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (touched) Aw, Barn... And he grabs Barney in a big bear hug. Tears in both their eyes, they slap each other on the back, two prehistoric sensitive guys.

dialogues.speaker: FIBRESPHERE
dialogues.text: Little cupola cars are chugging around the upper level of the Fibresphere, where they enter a tunnel-like open- ing labeled "THE WORLD OF FIBRE." Wilma, Betty, the kids and Dino are in one of these. Now, we FOLLOW them as they chug into --  206 207 208 209 92.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIBRESPHERE "WORLD OF FIBRE" RIDE 206
dialogues.text: The cupolas rattle along in Disneyland style, passing a sign which reads: "FIBREROCK--TRANSFORMING THE HOME." Here, mechanical figures in an all-Fibre home move klutzily around the room.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (a la 'The Great Gildersleeve' ) Welcome! Welcome to the fabulous world of tomorrow... a world brought to you by Fibrerock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALING that behind the hollow shells of the human family is a veritable family of monkeys, all working the figures like puppets. A PARROT at a stand-mounted microphone is giving the narration.

dialogues.speaker: PARROT, (RECORDING)
dialogues.text: Here, we see a typical family of the future, free of the cares and worries of today... yes, the great kibble crisis is a thing of the past when you're living the good life... the Fibrelife!

dialogues.speaker: NEXT EXHIBIT 208
dialogues.text: The CARS CHUG past a display of tree trunks, leaves, bubbling gunk... and those iridescent vegetable pearls we've come to know... coo-coo berries. Iron bars and vault-like doors separate the coo-coo berries from the other items.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PARROT
dialogues.text: Here, gathered from the four corners of the globe, are the secret ingredients of Fibrerock... some common, some rare... all making life easier for you and yours!

dialogues.speaker: THIRD EXHIBIT 209
dialogues.text: The little CARS CHUG into an elegant salon, complete with runway. There's another PARROT here in front of another megaphone, but this parrot is chic and flamboyant.

dialogues.speaker: FASHION PARROT
dialogues.text: But does Fibrerock belong only in the kitchen, the garage, the workplace? No, no, no, my darlings!  210 211 212 93.

dialogues.speaker: FASHION MODELS ON RUNWAY 210
dialogues.text: As each girl struts forward, she shrugs off a bulky animal fur and tosses it into a garbage can. Underneath are all kinds of daring and tantalizing fashions woven in the tell-tale fibre colors. The clothes are a blend of the future and retro (that is, prehistoric retro).

dialogues.speaker: FASHION PARROT
dialogues.text: Because the clothes of the Stone Age are as extinct as stones themselves! Yes, thanks to the wonder of Fibrerockfibre, the world of high fashion will be totally transformed... by Fibre furs... Fibre frocks... Fibre foundations and Fibreshoes... it's to die for!

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH EXHIBIT 211
dialogues.text: Now, we see a display of Fibrerock props of all kinds -- appliances, toys, tools, etc... all of it upstaged by a choir consisting of every animal, bird and critter we've seen in this film. Wilma, Betty, the kids and Dino ooh and ahh with the other guests as the mechanical animals all sing in unison --

dialogues.speaker: FIBRE CHOIR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "It's a Fibre World you know, It's a Fibre World you know, It's a Fibre World you know -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney are surrounded by books and cartons and memorabilia. They have their arms around each other and are singing.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: "Now it's time to do or die, grab that rock and kick it high, let's fight, fight, fight for Bedrock High! ' They break up laughing. Fred chuckles, looks at one of the many old photographs strewn around.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Boy, those were the days, Barney. Bedrock High winning all those games... and you and me right in the middle of it.  213 94.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING PHOTO 213
dialogues.text: The photograph (dots in stone) shows the young Fred and Barney in their cheerleading costumes. Barney has a sweater and megaphone; Fred is in a Godzilla-like "mascot" costume. He's holding the hideously-sculpted head under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Too bad we never made the team.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: So what? We made the team spirit. That's just as important... whatever happened to those cheerleader costumes?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You know Betty. She never throws anything away. He hauls out an old footlocker, opens it. There they are.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (rummaging in it) Boy. Talk about memories. Fred tosses the cheerleader sweater to Barney, who grins, pulls it on. Fred also starts to get into his old "uniform," but has to suck his gut in mightily. Finally, he can zip it up, stern to stem.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Back then, we thought a pop quiz was a big problem. We didn't know how good we had it. No problems, no worries... Saying this, Fred attempts to put on the Godzilla-like head. He has a hard time sliding it into a hinge rail behind his neck, an even harder time swinging it down and forward.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Speaking of problems and worries, shouldn't we get on over to Slate's party? Fred has finally "clinked" the monster head down into place. Now, when he talks, the monster's mouth moves in sync. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (echo-y) What for? So him and all his fancy friends can look down their noses at us? Completely covered in the ferocious-looking suit, Fred steps over to Barney, stabs an angry claw in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (echo-y) All they've been doing is using us, Barney. And meanwhile -- Now Fred reaches up to take the head off. It sticks for a moment. Finally he gets it to flip back on its hinge where it hangs behind his neck like a ski parka hood.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (normal voice) -- Meanwhile all the time they were laughing at us.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah? When did you notice that?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: About an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Boy, there's no fooling you, Fred. Suddenly, with a GROWING CREAKING, CRACKING and TINKLING, a scale model of Slate City in the corner begins to fall apart. Fred and Barney look at each other, startled, then rush over to the model. It's the interim version we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decomposition continues, walls and supports turning into sand and running down before our eyes. In a Rube Goldberg-like continuum, the little houses go first, falling like dominoes...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wha... what's happening? Barney tries to stop the process, can't. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I... I don't know... the Fibrerock it's... it's decomposing... but this shouldn't happen...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Your old models are just fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, the older models from Barney's tinkering days are rock solid.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It should be. There's enough coo-coo berry resin in there to petrify a brontosaurus -- Suddenly Barney gets it. He looks from the older models to the now decomposing little Fibresphere with growing awareness.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (snapping his fingers) -- The coo-coo berries! Fred, that's it!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What's it?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Remember I said the Fibrefoam tasted funny? It was the coo-coo sap that was missing!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: But.. why would --

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why? Because coo-coo berries are as valuable as goldrock! And we've had tons of â€˜em delivered to the plant since we started... somebody musta got greedy --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: -- Not 'somebody' -- Lava!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Fred, that sap acts as a fixative -- it's the glue that holds the whole formula together -- ! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (with mounting concern) Then... what's happening here...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (finishing it) ... Is gonna happen for real in the real Slate City!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Oh no... Barney! Wilma and Betty -- and the kids -- they're all there -- With a final WHIMPER, the little FIBRESPHERE CAVES IN and then the nearby SLATE NEEDLE CRUMBLES, model story by model story. Finally the "DISK" on top of the needle is all that's left, wobbling around like a spun dinner plate. It finally falls... EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (worried) -- B-barney... what do we do? Barney runs to a locker, grabs a big plunger-powered flit gun, begins filling it with a red liquid.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Coo-coo berry sap, Fred! It's our only chance -- their only chance! Barney gives it a quick test squirt. Fred nods, and they rush out of the room. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON the ruins of the model "Slate City"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN FROM a young kid who is drinking a glass of water and simultaneously singing with a ventriloquist's dummy. Obviously, the talent show has begun. In the audience, Lava fidgets with nervous and confident energy... gives Wilma a big look.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: You're certainly looking lovely this evening, Mrs. Flintstone. Life with a junior executive must agree with you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Uh... thank you... I think.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (looking into her eyes) Yes. I think so, too. (smiling) Imagine how good you'd look with a senior executive.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Oh? Is Fred getting promoted? Lava laughs, sure she's kidding... then not so sure. The ventriloquist finishes to scattered applause. The kid bows, gets up... splashes across puddles of water on the stage area. The Headmistress of L'ecole Superior et al steps up. Behind her, the picture window displays the expanse of Slate City: The twin Slatescrapers framing endless rows of little tract houses stretching to the distant volcanic ridge.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISTRESS
dialogues.text: (as applause dies) Sank you, ladies and gentlemen. An' sank you, Monsieur Slate for zis lovely setting. Zoot alors, zis will ze mos' fantas'tic recital in Bedrock 'istoree. Now, I would like to sank out mos' generous benefactress, Madame Slate for her fine support o'vair zee years -- She gestures into the audience, where Mrs. Slate stands, waves a gloved hand like the Queen Mother.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISTRESS
dialogues.text: -- An' now, what better introduction could we â€˜ave for Mrs. Slate's vairy own gran' nephew... Poindexter Lava! She steps aside. Curtain rises on little Poindexter. He is carrying a leather-and-bone accordion. He begins to play:

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER
dialogues.text: (singing loudly) "Dino of Spain, I adore you Right from the moment I saw you --  218 219 220 221 222 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their smiles become fixed. (Up on the spotlights, the little birds who operate the lights put earplugs in their ears.) In the wings with Pebbles and Bam-Bam, DINO MOANS, hides his head under his paws. On the refreshment table, GLASSES CRACK... a cake falls.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA 219
dialogues.text: He surreptitiously checks his wrist watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one a pocket job. (Like Lava's, it's really a little sundial with a built-in burning match above it to provide a shadow!) We WIDEN, and see that this watch is held in a green, scaley claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the xenosaurus, lurking behind the exhibits! Now, the CREATURE GRUNTS confidently, lights up a cigar. Then it picks up a canvas bag and a big toolbox and tiptoes into the deeper recesses of the Fibre ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney rush along, Fred at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What'1ll we do when we get there?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We just tell Mister Slate that all 500 acres of his development are going to crumble into dust any minute. (holds up the flit gun) Then we zap the stairs and corridors with some of this coo-coo sap. I just hope we have enough to get everybody out -- whoops! He's said this last because as he held up the flit gun, the handle whacked the back of Fred's monster costume, and the head has flipped down with a solid "clink." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barney -- ! (swerving all over the road) -- I can't see straight -- Barney gets up on his knees, grabs the wheel with one hand and the monster head with the other.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on -- Oops. He rotates the head completely around. Fred flails around. Barney grabs the wheel with one hand, tries to help Fred with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens around even more wildly now. There's several near collisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Rockdonald's" is, of course, complete with golden arches of stone, a drive-up window, etc. It even has the oblig- atory cops on a break... in this case, Feldspar and Gravel. They're sitting in their patrol car eating from little bamboo containers shaped just like McDonald's Styrofoam. (Of course, the logo on the building behind them proudly reads "OVER 100 SOLD.")

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (mouth full, bitching) Speed traps again! Face it, Gravel. I'm ina rut... and meanwhile, the guys who went through the academy with me, they're all big shots now: Sam Slate... Dirty Harock... Magma, P.I. And you know why? "Cause they got the breaks, that's why! Suddenly both officers react to the sound of SKIDDING TIRES and HONKING HORNS. They look out their window at --

dialogues.speaker: FRED AND BARNEY
dialogues.text: both still battling the wheel and the resistant costume head. (By now their gyrations have put Barney's face inside the jaws of the monster mask.)  101.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 226
dialogues.text: They do a

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: S-sarge, d-did you see that? Some sorta creature was attacking that little guy -- !

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: There's a lesson there, Gravel... never pick up hitchhikers. Besides -- (realizing) -- Did you say 'creature'? big double-take at the now-vanishing car.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: The xenosaurus! Excited, Feldspar bangs his dashboard and a DISPATCH PARAKEET in a police uniform pops INTO VIEW. Feldspar grabs it around the neck, holds it like a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: This is a xenosaurus alert. Repeat, a xenosaurus alert. The creature has been sighted on the Slate City exit of the Venturock Freeway! It is driving a brown late model sedan and eating a white male Caucasian. Car twelve is in hot pursuit. He releases the bird, which doesn't fly away right away, but gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (remembering) Oh, yeay... over and out! The bird nods, appeased, flies off.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH PARAKEET
dialogues.text: (as it goes) Awwk! Car Twelve is on the way. Car Twelve is on the way...

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Gravel, this could mean promotions for both of us! (trotting up to speed) Load the shotgun and turn on the siren!  227 228 229 230 102.

dialogues.speaker: FRED'S CAR
dialogues.text: Barney is rocking Fred's head back and forth, finally gives it one last mighty yank. Something breaks. Barney falls back on the passenger side of the car. Fred drives with one hand, "raps" the monster head. It rattles. When Fred speaks again, the monster mouth no longer opens and closes in sync.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (muffled, shouting) Ho, gweat! Hoo bwoke hit, Bahnee! Hi khnat twalk hennymore! Suddenly both men (pardon, man and xenosaurus) react to an approaching SIREN. They both look back at --

dialogues.speaker: FELSPAR'S PATROL CAR 228
dialogues.text: Closing in. Gravel has produced a little sabre tooth CAT and is "cranking" its tail. As it WAILS away, the cops close in on our heroes.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Ho noh! Ahhrisser Felghspah! (turning to Barney) Haybee whee hould shtop -- ?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What, and explain what you're doing in that costume? Start talking about coo-coo berries and Fibrerock? By then it'll be too late!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: "Hen yore height, yore height... Fred pours on more speed. They careen around a turn. CAMERA WHIP PANS TO a road sign: SLATE CITY--1 MI.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE CITY
dialogues.text: A fence surrounds the empty housing development; in the distance, we can see the dark Slate Scrapers, and past them, the brightly-lit and gleaming Fibersphere and Slate Needle. We hear a SCREECH and then the CAMERA PANS BACK to pickup Fred's CAR as it whips around a turn, two wheels off the ground. It crashes right into the gate, knocking down a sign reading "SLATE CITY--DELIVERY GATE." The fence collapses all around the car.  231 232 233 234 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney stagger out of the wreck. Barney, covered with debris, rummages around and sighs with relief when he finds the flit gun of coo-coo sap is still intact.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (hearing a siren) We'd better split up; that way at least one of us can make it to the Slate Needle -- !

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: "Ood hidea. Ood whuk, ol' bhudee. They slap hands together like basketball players, then head off in two directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the audience as the accordion recital con- tinues. Several people look visibly ill. Finally, CAMERA ADJUSTS to take in Poindexter's big finish as he slides forward on his knees. There's a scattering of half-hearted applause, led by Lava and the Slates.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISTRESS
dialogues.text: Sank you, sank you. Our nex' performance is Bam-Bam, Pebbles... (checking notes) an' friend. She steps aside as a spotlight picks out --

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES, BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: poised in the stances we recognize as the "first positions" of the "Dino Dance." However, whereas the previous version of this was done impromptu and a cappella with only a few primitive props and straw hats alone, this time the kids and Dino are fully costumed, with sequins, batons and the like, and the dance is completely choreographed.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: You can keep the twist, the frug and hop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Dino dance begins, FULL ORCHESTRATION OVER IT. The audience seems to really like it -- all except --  235 236 104.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE 235
dialogues.text: who glances over at the judges long enough to see that they like this a lot better than the accordion act. Suddenly Mrs. Slate jumps up, barges on stage. The MUSIC DIES.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISTRESS
dialogues.text: Madame Slate, what ees wrong -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's wrong! This "act' is an absolute disgrace! This is supposed to be a talent show! And a pedestrian animal act like this belongs in a circus!

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND BETTY 236
dialogues.text: React, furious, jump out of their seats.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: A circus, huh? Well, if our kids belong in a circus with their act, then your little nephew belongs in a zoo with his --

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Yeah -- a zoo where the animals are dead -- because if they aren't, they will be!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: Why, how dare you! Mrs. Flintstein, I'll have you know that my little Poindexter has been trained by the finest tutors! Poindexter! Show them! Encore! The kid jumps up, begins to play. Immediately another GLASS SHATTERS. But then the CEILING FIXTURES CRACK, and then the PICTURE WINDOW PANELS begin to SHATTER one by one.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Ah... Poindexter... that's enough Poindexter...? The kids stops... But another WINDOW PANEL EXPLODES. Then one of the tables collapses. Pause. Every head in the room swivels around and stares at Poindexter. Nervous, he tosses the accordion aside. But the destruction continues: Another WINDOW PANEL SHATTERS. Then, the entire building shakes.  237 238 239 240 105.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE 237
dialogues.text: Loses his balance, grabs onto Lava for support, ends up pulling him down, too. Slate gets to his knees and looks out the window... and his jaw drops in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE CITY 238
dialogues.text: In the distance, with a CRACKLING ROAR, the little rows of Fibrerock tract houses are falling like dominoes in a wave that is rolling toward the Slate Needle.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE CITY DEVELOPMENT
dialogues.text: A flashlight beam rakes the CAMERA. Feldspar, shotgun in one hand, light in the other, looks around cautiously. (The shotgun has a slingshot mechanism; the flashlight is a mirror-backed candle. ) Behind him, FOOTSTEPS APPROACH. Feldspar tenses, but it's --

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: No sign of the driver...

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: You kidding? By now he's a couple of shinbones and a belch. Gravel drops down on one knee, excited. He shines his light on Fred's big "clawprints."

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: Holy cowasaurus! Look how deep these tracks are! That xeno thing must weigh a ton! They aim their lights at the tracks, begin to follow them. Suddenly they round a corner and come face to face with --

dialogues.speaker: FRED 240
dialogues.text: He's stopped between two sample homes to wrestle with the monster head again. Now, he freezes in twin flash- light beams!

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: Okay, lizard, reach for the sky! Fred hesitates... then, hearing a CREAK and GROAN, he looks at the HOUSE beside him. The stucco-like exterior of Fibrerock is beginning to crumble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Offisser Fledapar, het me hexpwain -- his howse hiss maid uv fibahwock -- He reaches out to tap the nearby wall and -- WHAM -- it collapses all around him, leaving a gaping hole in the house!

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (frightened, backing away ) Quivering quartzite, d-did you see that --

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: (following him) O-one flick of his paw... and he knocked down a wall -- !

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Nogh, wate, chum baggk -- As Fred "roars" and moves forward, Feldspar and Gravel scream, panic, and run!

dialogues.speaker: FRED 241
dialogues.text: Tries to catch up and collides with the already damaged house. It collapses totally, falling in on itself, obscuring Fred. Finally the last TIMBER DROPS. Pause. Fred staggers out of the rubble, realizes that the impact has knocked the monster mask off his head and back on its hinges. He rubs dust out of his eyes, turns and looks at the Slate Needle. He's much closer to it now. Quickly, he runs toward it.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SLATE NEEDLE 242
dialogues.text: Everyone is rocking back and forth with the escalating vibrations of the swaying building. The remaining table of refreshments slides across the room.

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER LAVA 243
dialogues.text: gets hit full force by a flying cake shaped like Slate City. He falls on top of his accordion, smashing it with one last dissonant squeeze.  244 245 246 247 248 249 107.

dialogues.speaker: PARTYGOERS 244
dialogues.text: They pause in their panic to applaud gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The supporting pylons and cable anchors begin to slowly decompose. A FLIGHT of STAIRS CREAKS AND GROANS. Barney runs INTO the SHOT, sees the steps about to go, dives for them... too late! He ends up with a face full of Fibredust! Now, he whirls as Fred runs up, points --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barney! The elevator -- ! Barney runs toward it, hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF WALL 246
dialogues.text: REVEALING elevator mechanism. The button pokes a mouse which runs out of a box. Seeing the mouse, a nearby mastadon becomes frightened, begins running. A heavy cable tied to the mastadon runs over a pulley and into --

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR SHAFT 247
dialogues.text: -- where the elevator rises out of the sub-level and INTO VIEW! Fred and Barny start towards it... when suddenly the Fibrerock elevator begins to crumble!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Quick! Use your coo-coo gun -- ! Barney aims, pulls back the plunger... too late! The elevator is gone. The cable swings back and forth loosely, "whapping" the shaft walls as it shoots upwards. Fred dives for the cable, misses! As he stumbles, Barney leaps on Fred's back, catches the cable! As Barney starts to whizz upwards, Fred garbs onto his ankles!

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Propelled upwards, the would-be rescuers shoot OUT of the FRAME, disappear into the Fibresphere with a CRASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE CHIEF looks skeptically at Feldspar and Gravel, who are exhausted, covered with dust, uniforms torn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Feldspar, if you ask me, you've seen too many Rockzilla movies: In all the Xenosaurus sightings we've had reported, not one has had this kind of wholesale destruction --

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
