dialogues.text: Chief, you -- you gotta believe me -- just one swipe of its paw and -- wham -- a whole house was pre-history -- ! Suddenly one of those police DISPATCH PARAKEETS comes flying excitedly through the window, lands on a perch in front of the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH PARAKEET
dialogues.text: Calling all cars. Calling all cars. Unconfirmed reports of destruction and collapse at Slate City. Rescue vehicles are on the way. The xenosaurus has been spotted in the area. That is all. That is all.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (excited) You see -- ? I told you --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: All right, Feldspar, I'm convinced! As of this moment you're completely in charge of operation... (dramatic) "Xeno Dino'! Now, what do you need? CAMERA TIGHTENS ON Feldspar. This is the moment he's waited for all his life.

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: (firm- jawed) Artillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust and little fragments of construction material are still tinkling down around our heroes. The elevator cable sways from its uppermost pulley. Slowly, something stirs in the pile of arms, legs and scaly limbs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: First to sit up is Barney, who groans, rubs his head. Next, Fred sits up. Damn! The impact has knocked Fred's monster mask back on his head! Fred mutters angrily... Barney starts to help... and then they both notice that there's another monstrous head in the middle of their group! There're big "takes" all around, and then the xenosaurus leaps out of the tangle of bodies, treads air, and runs away!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (recovering) Fred, stop it! It might know the way inside! Fred "gets up to speed" and chases the xeno. Barney follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney both leap on the mysterious xenosaurus -- all crash through a wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panicked partygoers turn as a section of wall collapses. Dust and debris billow upwards. The battered monster mask breaks loose from Fred's costume, bounces on the floor. Slowly, everyone gets up: Fred... Barney and two halves of the xenosaurus: The bottom half is Piltdown; the top-half is Pyrite.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA BETTY
dialogues.text: Fred? Barney?

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLES BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: Daddy! Pop!

dialogues.speaker: FRED BARNEY
dialogues.text: Piltdown? Pyrite?

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: What the devil's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: It's real simple, Mister Slate. Your boy Lava here has been stealing the coo-coo berries from the Fibrerock mix and fixing the books to hide it!

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous, Flintstone! Nobody could get that many coo-coo berries off our premises! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly the bottom of Piltdown's canvas sack rips open. Thousands and thousands of coo-coo berries tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA 253
dialogues.text: Slaps his hands over his face.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: (dryly) These sure look like coo-coo berries to me --

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (smoothly) They're convincing fakes, Mrs. Rubble -- part of our exciting display --

dialogues.speaker: PYRITE
dialogues.text: Fakes? (to Piltdown) Gee, Pilty, I thought the real ones were gonna be moved up here for us ta steal -- whatta waste a time --

dialogues.speaker: PILTDOWN
dialogues.text: Pyrite, shaddup --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (snapping fingers) Now I remember! These guys were pulling this xenosaurus act that night at the plant! What's this, Lava... 'Plan B'?

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: Uncle! Are you going to stand there while aspersions are being cast at the Slate family? This is absurd --

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Of course it is! Why, without the coo-coo berry sap, Fibrerock would be completely -- (realizing) -- unstable... Suddenly the entire building shudders. Dust falls from the ceiling. Everyone looks at Lava. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: All right, all right, I admit it! I got in over my head in the stock market... took some big losses... I had these guys pull jobs for me all over town disguised as a monster... but it still wasn't enough... and when I saw all those coo-coo berries being delivered every day, I guess I just lost my head... I figured with the Woca sap in the Fibremix, the berry juice as superfluous...

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's superfluous, Lava... your liver! So why don't we remove it -- ! He leaps, snarling, on top of Lava... Fred and Barney pull them apart. Then, more falling dust and beams give everyone more pressing problems --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue VEHICLES and police CARS ROAR up, slam to a halt, CAT SIRENS WAILING. The rescue workers jump out. Firefighters carry circular trampolines of hide stitched to bamboo frames; others go to the back of their trucks and start to turn cranks on the hook and ladder trucks to raise the ladders.

dialogues.speaker: A HOOK AND LADDER TRUCK 256
dialogues.text: It's actually a wheeled carriage carrying a firesaurus, which is a critter with a very tiny body and an incred- ibly long neck. The bony plates on the creature's back make perfect stairs. However, the creature is noticeably listless and uncooperative.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, what's the hold up -- ?

dialogues.speaker: FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: It's the kibble crisis, sir -- the firesauruses have been on half-rations for a month! Above them, the BUILDING SHUDDERS again.  257 258 259 112.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SLATE NEEDLE 257
dialogues.text: Now, the remaining LIGHT FIXTURES CRASH down. When they hit the floor, the oil lamps inside spills and fire spreads.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: (pointing) Fred! There's a fire hose -- ! Indeed, it's on the back wall in a closed box marked FIRE HOSE--IN CASE OF EMERGENCY BREAK GLASS. Fred and Barney take a step towards it, but the fire quickly spreads and cuts them off. Helpless, they step back. With a THUNDEROUS ROAR, the two SLATE SCRAPERS visible through what's left of the picture window COLLAPSE. Then the big statue of Slate just outside the window begins to decompose. It falls in on itself like a sand sculpture in a storm... finally, for a split second it is, well, life-sized, and then the head of the statue snaps loose, CRASHES through the only remaining pane of GLASS here rolls up to Slate's feet. Pause. Everyone looks at everyone else. This is it: Titanic time. Fred embraces Wilma... Barney embraces Betty. Their kids are pulled into the clinch. Even Slate takes Mrs. Slate's hand. Talk about grace under pressure... and speaking of --

dialogues.speaker: GRACE 258
dialogues.text: -- the star fashion model, suddenly her Fibrethread costume decomposes, leaving her in her cute little animal print undies.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY 259
dialogues.text: In the middle of going down with the ship, she turns Bam-Bam's face away from this display.

dialogues.speaker: BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: D-dad, are we gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (pause; false smile) Sure, pal. We just gotta wait for the fire department. Right, Fred?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Y-yeah. Everything's gonna be just -- Whoa, hoo-hah, aggh -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He's started yelping because he's realized his arm is on fire, and now he jumps up and the others begin beating at the arm with anything in their hands, and then Fred suddenly pushes away from them, stands there with a small flame flickering on his forearm like a Rock Vegas stage magician.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: -- Wait a minute -- I don't feel anything at all -- With his other "claw" he slaps tentatively at the flames, and then confidentially snuffs it out.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It must be the suit, Fred -- old Bedrock High built them things to last -- Fred looks over at the wall of flame separating the guests from the fire hose. As everyone gets the same idea, Dino rushes up, the costume head in his mouth. All brighten. Barney helps Fred with the head, twists it into place.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (rapping on the head) -- Okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hist hust fine! He lowers his head, runs through the fire, which licks at him harmlessly. Then with his claw, he SMASHES the amber GLASS --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOX 260
dialogues.text: A big PYTHONSAURUS is curled up inside, SNORING. (Note to herpetologists: The pythonosaurus is not quite a snake: it has little vestigial forepaws the better to emote with. Right now the snoring head is in those little paws.) The Pythonsaurus stirs, looks at Fred, "sniffs" the smoke. Then he raises one hand and finger as if to say "one moment." Then the pythonsaurus turns his head towards a nozzle like the ones in hamster cages, slurps loudly. We hear gallons and gallons of WATER GURGLING away...  261 262 263 114.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MAIN ROOM 261
dialogues.text: Everyone retreats from the fire. Slate picks up the head of the statue, his only souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: WITH FRED 262
dialogues.text: Waiting impatiently until the pythonsaurus finally finishes drinking. It wipes its mouth daintily with a napkin, slaps a little fire helmet on its head, turns and runs back into the other room. (Behind him, yards and yards of pythonsaurus unroll from a hidden compart - ment behind the box.) Water shoots out of the creature's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred turns in a semi-circle and puts out every lick of flame in the room. All the guests cheer, rush forward and slap Fred on the back. Pebbles jumps up on him and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hit fuzz nudding... wheely... The pythonsaurus looks around at the attention.

dialogues.speaker: PYTHONSAURUS
dialogues.text: Hey, what am I, chopped liver?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Come on, everybody -- we'll go out the way we came! Barney squirts a pathway with his flit gun, solidifying a route in the crumbling Fibrerock. Then Barney and Fred stand back nobly, wave everyone on into the adjacent Fibresphere.

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER
dialogues.text: (pushing and shoving) Outta the way -- outta the way -- women and children first -- ! I mean, ah, children and women first, yeah, yeah, provided that uh, there's room for the women... Meanwhile, the pythonsaurus gives Fred (or rather his costume) a big look up and down, looks TOWARD the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: PYTHONSAURUS
dialogues.text: Hey, not bad. Wonder if she lives around here. Just then Fred tilts back the monster head. The pythonsaurus reacts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PYTHONSAURUS
dialogues.text: Heartbreaker! Depressed, the pythonsaurus follows the others. Fred and Barney cross over into the Fibresphere. As the do, Slate Needle completely collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slate Needle tumbles down, taking a big chunk of the Fibresphere with it! But the rest of the huge globe stays put... for now.

dialogues.speaker: RESCUE WORKERS BELOW 265
dialogues.text: gasp, cry out --

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE 266
dialogues.text: Already the first partygoers are sliding down the elevator cable.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISTRESS
dialogues.text: (panicking) Oh, geez, we're all gonna croak -- I neva shoulda left Far Rockaway -- Wilma gives her a big suspicious look -- blanching, the Headmistress slides down the cable --

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 267
dialogues.text: The rescue teams catch the people in nets as they hit the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE 268
dialogues.text: Barney gives the dwindling circle of solid Fibre around the group another shot of coo-coo juice. Poindexter Lava pushes his way forward.

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER
dialogues.text: (to anyone and everyone) Fifty clams for a piggy-back ride a hundred clams!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: (aghast) Do you see that, Jerry? Do you see how my great-nephew is behaving at this moment of crisis? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAVA
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yeah. Real chip off the old block, ain't he? Embarrassed, Mrs. Slate grabs the kid by the neck practically throws him at the cable. She follows him down, followed by Lava and Mr. Slate.

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF FLEEING PEOPLE 269
dialogues.text: Fred and Barney have bravely held up the rear, their families clutching to them. Barney's carrying Bam-Bam.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (to Pebbles) Upsy-daisy, sweetheart -- piggy back time! She jumps on his back... slamming the monster head back in place.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (resigned) Hohh... GWEAT!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Betty) Go on, honey... I got Bam-Bam!

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Barney... tonight you're the biggest man in Bedrock. She kisses him, slides down.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND FRED 270
dialogues.text: Backlit romantically by the flames, just like Gable and Leigh when Atlanta burned.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (through the mask) Wilmagh, I jusght whunt to sagh thad I knogh shumtimes I dogh dumb thinks... Bhut hit's becaughse high luff yough sogh much thaght high whant yough to livgh likge a pwincess orgh a qween â€˜cause you reaally arggh rugg aaggg hummmmg higga! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Oh, Fred -- that's the most beautiful thing I've ever heard! They kiss... she drops to safety...!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 271
dialogues.text: Wilma slides into a rescue net, gets on unsteady feet next to Betty.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Lhet's dogh it! Their kids on their backs, Fred and Barney exchange a heroic forearm-to-forearm gladiator-type handshake... both put their hands on the cable... and then the whole pulley mechanism falls right down between them and through the hole! A second later, the entire remaining structure collapses!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 273
dialogues.text: Everyone reacts in horror --

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE 274
dialogues.text: Dust and smoke clear. When we can see again, well, it's not a pretty sight. The entire fibresphere is gone. All that's left, teetering on two spindly supports, are two tiny islands of safety connected by a twisted maze of rubble too small for a human to negotiate... and all that's holding that up is a long guide wire leading to th ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures on one of the islands stir: Fred. Barney. Bam-Bam... Pebbles! The platform shudders again. Barney aims the flit gun -- empty! The dads hold on to the kids. It's all they can do.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW 276
dialogues.text: Wilma and Betty gasp... what can be done?

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND ISLAND 277
dialogues.text: Bricks and chunks of Fibre stir... a form sits up... it's -- Dino! He looks around at the situation, becomes agitated... he wants to help... but how?  278 279 280 281 282 283 118.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND BETTY 278
dialogues.text: Suddenly become inspired.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: W-wilma... those hoops of bamboo... those wires... do you think -- ?

dialogues.speaker: WILMA
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Betty, we have to try it -- ! Dino! Dino, look down here -- !

dialogues.speaker: DINO 279
dialogues.text: Obeys, puzzled --

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND BETTY 280
dialogues.text: Amazingly, they grab scraps of wood, borrow fire fighter's helmets, and begin to do a buck and wing.

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND BETTY
dialogues.text: You can keep the twist, the frug and hop I don't need to shimmy, I don't need to bop --

dialogues.speaker: BIG CAMERA PUSH
dialogues.text: MUSIC COMES UP DRAMATICALLY as he catches on! His eyes fill with courage and he charges toward the spindly bridge that leads to his master and friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dino dives through the hoops of bamboo, duplicating his steps in "The Dino Dance." He reaches the other island! Without a beat, still keeping time, he puts the two kids on his shoulders, just like in the dance! Then he "presents" his tail to Fred -- Fred hands his tail to Barney -- and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Dino slides down the long wire, carrying everyone to safety! They all plow into the biggest rescue net as Wilma and Betty wind up!

dialogues.speaker: WILMA AND BETTY
dialogues.text: Yes, I don't need to shimmy, I don't need to bop "Cause I'm doin', doin', doin'

dialogues.speaker: FRED 284
dialogues.text: rolls out of the net and away from the others. He's slightly stunned, still in the suit. He sits up... suddenly lights snap on all around him! Fred looks up and sees --

dialogues.speaker: CORDON OF POLICE OFFICERS 285
dialogues.text: All with weapons aimed right at him. Spotlights on the police car roofs (actually little fires with parabolic mirrors) are operated by uniformed monkeys. Feldspar is at the head of the group. He cocks his shotgun. The elastic catapults at the hammers twitch menacingly --

dialogues.speaker: FELDSPAR
dialogues.text: It's the xenosaurus -- stand back men -- it's a vicious killer -- Ready -- Aim --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (with desperate poignancy) High ham noght a zenosore! High ham hay hooman beeng -- ! BAM! WHAM! KABAM! Bullets and projectiles begin slamming all around Fred! He ducks behind a big fallen chunk of Fibrerock -- catches his breath as the bullets and shells bounce off its resilient surface.

dialogues.speaker: FRED 286
dialogues.text: Momentarily safe, he tries desperately to remove that stupid head -- bangs it against the wall, tears at it with his claws -- -- meanwhile, the chunk of Fibrerock protecting him decomposes! He's back in the line of fire!

dialogues.speaker: DINO 287
dialogues.text: Flanked by Wilma, Barney and the kids, who are shouting for the police to stop, only Dino the wonder bronto has the wits to act! "YI-YI-YI-ING," he races forward, CAMERA FOLLOWING -- and with lightning reflexes grabs the seat of Fred's monster suit and -- de-pants him! Instantly, Dino whirls Fred around, points to the now revealed striped undershorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then Officer Gravel takes a good look at that rear end.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEL
dialogues.text: Hey, those are the biggest shorts I've ever seen... (realizing) ... It... it must be Mister Flintstone! Cease fire! (to Feldspar) Gee, Sarge, now you don't have to shoot him -- ! Now Fred confirms Gravel's hunch as the costume head finally pops off. All the cops lower their guns. (Strangely, though, Feldspar still continues to raise his gun -- even aims! Then an alarmed Gravel wrestles it away from his superior.)

dialogues.speaker: THE FLINTSTONES AND RUBBLES
dialogues.text: Safe, they all emotionally embrace. Fred even suffers Dino's affection. (In the b.g., a police car holding Piltdown, Pyrite and Lava drives past. Poindexter Lava is chasing the car.)

dialogues.speaker: POINDEXTER
dialogues.text: (distant) Dad! Dad! Can I use the Porscherock while you're in the slammer? Suddenly the Slates push their way into the group hug.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Flintstone. Rubble. I... I don't know what to say. I... I treated you horribly... I ignored you, abused you... and then you come here and risk your necks like this... well, there's no price you can put on something like that, so I won't even try. But let me give you... (with great poignancy) a hearty handshake.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: Dear, don't you think a little more than that is in order?

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Honey, you're being hysterical, go lie down, okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SLATE
dialogues.text: I am not being hysterical, I am being fair -- now the Flintsteins and Rabbles saved all of our lives, not to mention your reputation.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (sighing) Okay, okay. (to Fred and Barney) Boys, I'm feeling guilty about how you've been taken advantage of, so I'll tell you what... I'm going to give you back all world-wide rights to Fibrerock free and clear. He picks up a fragment of stone, begins writing on it.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: Your only obligation will be to cover oh, whatever legal expenses might surface at some later time...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You think there's gonna be some? Slate looks around at --

dialogues.speaker: THE RUINS AND DESTRUCTION 290
dialogues.text: Smoking desolation as far as the eye and CAMERA can see. As we watch the last remaining fragment of Slate City collapse, crushing a police car.

dialogues.speaker: SLATE
dialogues.text: (casually) Oh, you never know...

dialogues.speaker: RESCUE DINOS 292
dialogues.text: Several sniff at the air, look curiously at a nearby pile of crumbled Fibrerock. One and then another shuffles over, tentatively tastes some... grins... and digs in! Seeing this, the "firesauruses" crane out their necks, also begin chowing down on the pile of Fibrerock crumbs.

dialogues.speaker: FRED, BARNEY, SLATE AND OTHERS 293
dialogues.text: All turn at the growing sound of the ANIMALS PIGGING OUT. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now DINO "YI-YI-YI'S" past this group and leaps into the pile, munching like crazy. Barney puts out his hand as chunks of Fibrerock shower down like rain from the feeding frenzy. Catching some pieces, he nibbles on it a little.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barn...? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sniffing it) Lava Lava leaves... Woca sap... all still there, but now the nutrients are all released... (realizing) Fred, this... this is Dino kibble!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Dino kibble...? Disbelieving, Fred moves over to the happily-munching animals. He has to get on his knees to wiggle in with the pack. He grabs some, stuffs it in his mouth... chews. His eyes widen...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Dhinough khibble! ! He spits it out, takes out the chunk of contract Slate wrote on.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Barney, we -- we're rich! Yabba dabba do -- !

dialogues.speaker: SLATE 294
dialogues.text: Faints dead away! The CAMERA PULLS BACK... BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back where we began. As "The End" appears on the drive-in screen, cars are streaming out of the drive-in theatre. The Flintstone car is among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and company roll into a '50's-style drive-in restaurant. A Sign advertises BRONTO BURGERS AND RIBS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A pretty carhop on stone roller skates glides over. Fred holds up one finger towards her. She nods, scampers 0.S. Fred rubs his hands and licks his lips with antici- pation... and then the girl returns with a massive rack of ribs on a car tray. She hooks it on the edge of the driver's door... and the entire car tips over with a crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN FROM the mailbox. Fred and family pull up. Dino runs in first, followed by Wilma with Pebbles already asleep on her shoulder. Fred follows, the saber-tooth cat on his heels. Fred stops in the doorway to put a milk bottle on the doorstep, and then puts the cat down beside it. He shuts the door. Quick as a flash, the cat leaps through the side window. Pause. The door opens and the cat puts Fred out, then slams the door! Fred recovers from his shock, tries the door... it's locked!

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We'll have a yabba dabba-do time A dabba-do time We'll have a gay old time!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (knocking) Wilma...? (another knock) . Wilma? CAMERA CRANES UP, WIDENS as Fred becomes a tiny sil- houette banging on the door.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wilma? Wil-ma --! FADE OUT.
